intro: Aneilema vitiense var. petiolata, commonly known as the Vitiense Petioled Aneilema, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its attractive, showy flowers that typically bloom in clusters. The plant features elongated petioles, which distinguish this variety from other forms of Aneilema vitiense. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
